pages.text: The Ritual of Nolite Ignem (Do Not Burn) is a powerful fire suppression ritual that continuously extinguishes all fires within a large radius. This ritual actively removes both regular fire and soul fire blocks, making it ideal for protecting flammable structures or preventing fire spread in dangerous areas.

pages.title: How It Works
pages.text: When active, the ritual scans for fire blocks within a 64-block radius (configurable) every second and extinguishes them.$(br2)The ritual consumes LP based on the number of fires extinguished:$(br)- 10 LP per fire block (default, configurable)$(br)- Scans every 1 second (20 ticks)$(br)- Cost scales with fire count

pages.title: Fire Detection
pages.text: The ritual detects and extinguishes:$(br)- Regular Fire blocks$(br)- Soul Fire blocks$(br2)The ritual uses spherical range detection, meaning it checks within a sphere centered on the master ritual stone. If there are no fires present, no LP is consumed (beyond the activation cost).

pages.title: LP Management
pages.text: If the network doesn't have enough LP to extinguish all fires:$(br)- The ritual will extinguish as many fires as it can afford$(br)- Remaining fires will be left until the next cycle$(br)- The owner will receive nausea as a warning$(br2)This ensures the ritual continues to function even when LP is running low.

pages.title: Configuration
pages.text: The Ritual of Nolite Ignem can be configured via the server config:$(br)- Fire Suppression Radius: Radius in blocks (default: 64, range: 1-256)$(br)- LP Per Fire: LP cost per fire extinguished (default: 10, range: 1-1000)$(br2)Activation Cost: 5000 LP$(br2)Refresh Time: 1 second (20 ticks)

pages.title: Ritual Structure
pages.text: The Ritual of Nolite Ignem uses a pattern with 8 Water runes (representing water's power to extinguish flames) and 4 Air runes (for extended range). The water runes form inner and middle rings, while air runes occupy the outer corners.

pages.title: Usage Tips
pages.text: This ritual is extremely useful for:$(br)- Protecting wooden or flammable builds$(br)- Preventing fire spread in the Nether$(br)- Clearing fire after lava interactions$(br)- Maintaining safe zones in fire-prone areas$(br2)At default settings with minimal fires, this ritual is very economical. However, in areas with constant fire (like the Nether), LP consumption can be significant.
